pinyin: ji3 gu3 shen2 jing1 yi1 xue2

sentences.english: The liver is served in a soup, and the spine is deep-fried and eaten like a cracker.
sentences.chinese: 肝臟入湯，油炸透的脊骨可以當餅乾喫。

sentences.english: It is articulated to the spine.
Starting at the base of the first dorsal spines.
sentences.chinese: 一條始於第一背脊骨基部。

sentences.english: A flap of skin was hanging from his body, exposing his spine and internal organs.
sentences.chinese: 有一塊皮從他身上垂下來，露出了脊骨和內臟。

sentences.english: The scream sent a prickle down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 尖叫聲聽得我像針由上到下刺我的脊骨。

sentences.english: Why do hummingbirds and gorillas both have backbones ?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼蜂鳥和大猩猩都有脊骨？

sentences.english: I will do to your spine what I just did to your front door.
sentences.chinese: 你的背脊骨就會和你的門一樣的下場。

sentences.english: Rows of large spines cover giant-spined sea stars off the coast of California.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲在加利福尼亞海邊的成行的大型脊骨海星。

sentences.english: And here's the spine , right here.
sentences.chinese: 你的背脊骨就會和你的門一樣的下場。

sentences.english: The prohibited items are brain, spine, thymus, tonsils, spleen and intestine.
sentences.chinese: 阻止的項目是腦，脊骨，胸腺，扁桃體，脾和腸。

sentences.english: Back to Hong Kong only the head and a fish tail spine.
sentences.chinese: 回港時只剩魚頭魚尾和一條脊骨。

sentences.english: Rage and hate flowed into her and stiffened her spine.
sentences.chinese: 忿怒和憎恨交併而來，立刻挺硬了她的脊骨。

definition: the back of the human body
back (of a human or other vertebrate)
